GIS' murder of S. Korean schoolgirls denounced
articles.content:
GIS' murder of S. Korean schoolgirls denounced 
     Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- The preparatory committee for the reunification meeting of youth and students in the south and north of Korea reportedly issued a statement on June 30 denouncing the GIS' murder of South Korean schoolgirls.
 The GIS have many things to apologize and compensate to the Korean nation not only for the current incident but for the backstage manipulation of the Kwangju massacre and the mass killings of civilians during the June 25 Korean War, the statement said, and went on:    
 We cannot allow the U.S. troops pursuing war policy and sacrificing the South Korean people to remain in this land any longer at a time when all the fellow countrymen are more dynamically advancing to reunify the country by the concerted efforts of the Korean nation, guided by the June 15 joint declaration  the youth and students will wage a vigorous struggle to pull the U.S troops out of South Korea.

Kim Yong Nam receives credentials from Croatian ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam receives credentials from Croatian ambassador
    Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, received credentials from Zeljko Kirincic, new Croatian ambassador  to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 Present there was Choe Su Hon, vice-minister of foreign affairs.    
 After receiving the credentials, the president had a talk with the ambassador.

articles.title: Greetings to president of Cape Verde
articles.content:
Greetings to president of Cape Verde
    Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Pedro Pires, President of Cape Verde, on July 1 on the occasion of the 27th anniversary of its independence and proclamation of the Republic.
 The message extended warm congratulations to the president and, through him, to the government and the people of Cape Verde.    
 Sincerely wishing him greater success in his work for the prosperity of the country and wellbeing of the people, it expressed belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the future.
